skill.name: spec-discovery
skill.description: Parse specs to extract IDs, titles, and traceability metadata (repo, path, hash).
skill.summary: Parse specs to extract IDs, titles, and traceability metadata (repo, path, hash).
skill.author: Consiliency

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Provides workflow instructions for AI agents to parse specification files and extract traceability metadata. No scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond normal AI context handling.

content.value_statement: Finding and tracking requirements across large codebases is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automatically locates specification files, extracts requirement IDs like REQ-NOTIFY-001, and generates a traceable manifest with content hashes for downstream validation.
actual_capabilities: Walk repository directories to locate specs/ and specs/external-requests/
Extract requirement IDs from markdown headings using regex pattern matching
Compute SHA-256 content hashes for integrity verification
Generate sorted manifest with source repository, file path, and anchor links
Flag duplicate spec IDs across repositories for conflict resolution
Support both JSON and TOON output formats for different workflows
limitations: Requires specification files to follow heading-based ID format (REQ-XXX-001)
Cannot process specifications in binary or non-markdown formats
Does not modify or write to specification files
Limited to configured repository roots (ROOT and EXTRA_REPOS variables)

use_cases.title: Trace requirements to implementation
use_cases.description: Map requirement IDs to source files and track changes across repositories for compliance audits.

use_cases.title: Validate specification coverage
use_cases.description: Verify that all stated requirements have corresponding test cases and implementation references.

use_cases.title: Generate documentation manifests
use_cases.description: Create machine-readable specification inventories for downstream CI/CD validation pipelines.

prompt_templates.title: Find all requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: Use spec-discovery to find all requirement IDs in this repository. Return the manifest showing each spec ID, title, source path, and content hash.

prompt_templates.title: Cross-repo requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: Use spec-discovery with EXTRA_REPOS pointing to other project repositories. Generate a combined manifest and flag any duplicate requirement IDs.

prompt_templates.title: External request specs
prompt_templates.prompt: Use spec-discovery to scan specs/external-requests/ directory. Extract all external API requirement IDs and generate traceable links to the source markdown files.

prompt_templates.title: Compliance verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Run spec-discovery to generate a manifest. Then compare current content hashes against a baseline to detect unauthorized specification changes.

output_examples.input: Find all requirements in this repository
output: Found 12 requirement IDs across 3 spec files
Note: No duplicate IDs detected across repositories

best_practices: Configure EXTRA_REPOS when working with multi-repository projects to capture all specifications
Store generated manifests alongside build artifacts for audit trail consistency
Review duplicate ID warnings before merging specifications from different teams
anti_patterns: Running spec-discovery without specifying ROOT for monorepos with nested project structures
Ignoring duplicate ID warnings which can cause downstream confusion in requirement tracking
Using spec-discovery to modify specifications rather than just reading and cataloging them

faq.question: What specification formats are supported?
faq.answer: Markdown files with heading-based requirement IDs following pattern REQ-[A-Za-z0-9_-]+. Other formats require preprocessing.

faq.question: Can this skill modify specification files?
faq.answer: No. Spec-discovery only reads and parses specifications. It generates manifests but does not alter source files.

faq.question: How are requirement IDs extracted?
faq.answer: Using regex pattern ^#+\s*(REQ-[A-Za-z0-9_-]+)\s*:?\s*(.*)$ matching markdown headings containing requirement identifiers.

faq.question: Is my specification data sent externally?
faq.answer: No. Spec-discovery runs entirely within the AI context. No data is transmitted to external servers or services.

faq.question: What causes requirements to be skipped?
faq.answer: Files in specs/templates/ are skipped. Files without matching ID pattern in headings are reported as having no IDs detected.

faq.question: How does this compare to grep or find commands?
faq.answer: Spec-discovery provides structured traceability including content hashes, repository context, and normalized links unlike basic text search.
